content: Electoral division in Singapore The **Tiong Bahru Group Representation Constituency** (GRC) was a three-member [group representation constituency](/wiki/Group_representation_constituency) in Singapore that existed from 1988 to 1991, consisting of the pre-GRC constituencies of [Anson](/wiki/Anson,_Singapore), Henderson, and Tiong Bahru. It was replaced by [Tanjong Pagar GRC](/wiki/Tanjong_Pagar_GRC) after one term in Parliament. The Members of Parliament (MPs) for this GRC were [Ch'ng Jit Koon](/wiki/Ch%27ng_Jit_Koon), [Chng Hee Kok](/wiki/Chng_Hee_Kok) and [S Vasoo](/wiki/S_Vasoo) from the [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) (PAP). ## History In 1991, Tiong Bahru GRC was merged into a new GRC, [Tanjong Pagar GRC](/wiki/Tanjong_Pagar_GRC). ## Members of Parliament YearDivisionMembers of ParliamentParty**Formation**(/wiki/1988_Singaporean_general_election) - Henderson - Radin Mas - Tiong Bahru - [S Vasoo](/wiki/S_Vasoo) - [Chng Hee Kok](/wiki/Chng_Hee_Kok) - [Ch'ng Jit Koon](/wiki/Ch%27ng_Jit_Koon) [PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**Constituency abolished (1991)** ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1980s [General Election 1988](/wiki/1988_Singaporean_general_election) PartyCandidateVotes%**[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)****[Chng Hee Kok](/wiki/Chng_Hee_Kok) [Ch'ng Jit Koon](/wiki/Ch%27ng_Jit_Koon) [S Vasoo](/wiki/S_Vasoo)** **31,732** **57.84** [WP](/wiki/Workers%27_Party_of_Singapore)[Low Thia Khiang](/wiki/Low_Thia_Khiang) Lim Lye Soon Gopalan Nair23,13242.16Majority8,60015.68Total valid votes54,86498.56Rejected ballots7991.44[Turnout](/wiki/Voter_turnout)55,66393.15[Registered electors](/wiki/Voter_registration)58,898[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) **win** (new seat) This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Tiong Bahru Group Representation Constituency
